name: 陳雅玫
objective: This is an introductory course aiming to familiarize students with basic concepts of translation, including qualifications of good translators, the procedure of translation, use of references & electronic tools and the idea of translation equivalence. Also, the relevance of contrastive studies between English and Chinese to translation will be introduced. A guided application of the linguistic knowledge to practical work will be provided, in the interest of assisting students in formulating suitable and appropriate translation strategies and techniques. This course is intended to prepare students for more specialized translation training.
schedule:
Week 1: course introduction
Week 2: (1) what makes a good translator; (2) translation procedure, equivalence and resources
Week 3: contrastive studies of lexicon & translation
Week 4: contrastive studies of verbs & translation (1)
Week 5: contrastive studies of verbs & translation (2)
Week 6: contrastive studies of nouns, pronouns and articles & translation
Week 7: group translation projects
Week 8: contrastive studies of prepositions, negative constructions, adjectives 
and adverbs & translation
Week 9: contrastive studies of conjunctions and word order
Week 10: contrastive studies of sentence structures & translation 
Week 11: contrastive studies of sentence patterns & translation 
Week 12: group translation projects
Week 13: contrastive studies of thinking & translation  
Week 14: commonly-used translation strategies (1)
Week 15: commonly-used translation strategies (2)
Week 16: contrastive studies of rhetoric & translation  
Week 17: lecture on culture and translation 
Week 18: final exam
scorePolicy:
1.	attendance and participation: 15%
2.	reflections of pre-readings: 10%
3.	two group translation projects: 25%
4.	translation assignments: 25%
5.	final-exam: 25%
